meanings.definition: A device that produces gyratory motion.
meanings.sent1: The toy gyroscope is a type of gyrator.
meanings.sent2: The washing machine has a built-in gyrator for better cleaning.
meanings.sent3: The dance floor was empty until someone turned on the gyrator, and everyone started dancing.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a gyrator, constantly spinning with new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The gyration of the gyrator created a mesmerizing display of motion.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that gyrates.
meanings.sent1: The hula dancer was a skilled gyrator.
meanings.sent2: The tornado was a powerful natural gyrator, destroying everything in its path.
meanings.sent3: The gyrator on the dance floor was so enthusiastic, they almost spun out of control.
meanings.sent4: His emotions were like a gyrator, swinging wildly from one extreme to another.
meanings.sent5: The gymnast moved like a graceful gyrator, twisting and turning with precision.
